oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The locusts (with the locust birds which accompany them) are set free by Sorcerers. Stones not to be thrown at the locusts. (L V.-21. 5708-5719 1/2). The locust bird (or ||kerri) travels about with locust 'flocks' and with sorcerers. Only sorcerers may release locusts from their hole - other people would die. The locusts and the locust birds are dangerous things or 'fighting things'. 1) p.5707v: this story was told to Dia!kwain's mother by the sorceress Tannu !kauken who heard it from her mother; Dutch farmers call the locust bird the springkan vogel, 2) Date on p.5715: 15 December, 3) See also The ||kerri and The locust birds, 4) This story is found in Book V-21.
